alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 7:29PM EDT until June 29 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Franklin County in western Maine... Eastern Oxford County in western Maine... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 729 PM EDT, emergency management reported flash flooding with numerous road closures in North Jay, Jay, Beans Corner, Wilton, and Farmington. Up to 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmington, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Wilton, Livermore, Chesterville, Vienna and New Sharon. Rainfall rates are slowing, but runoff will contribute to ongoing flooding over the next several hours. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Life Threatening flooding is occurring. If trapped, do not attempt to cross fast moving water. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
